729754f-a.text:
Tompkins Avenue, at the S. W. corner of Chestnut Avenue, showing the Garibaldi Memorial. The dwelling in which Giuseppe Garibaldi, the great Italian liberator, lived with his friend Meucci from 1851 to 1853 stands inside the Memorial.
November 30, 1937
Berenice Abbott
Federal Art Project--N. P. '~.
729754f-a.folder: Tompkins Avenue & Chestnut Avenue., Staten Island, NY

729751f-a.text:
Tompkins Avenue, at the S. W. corner of Chestnut Avenue, showing the Giuseppe Garibaldi House, in which the great Italian patriot lived with his friend Meucci, the candlemaker,from 1851 to 1853. The house was dedicated as a memorial on July 4, 1907 and is now protected by a temple-like structure. A bust of Garibaldi adorns the entrance
to the memorial.
About 1900
Photo by Mildenburg
From P. L. Sperr Collection
729751f-a.folder: Tompkins Avenue & Chestnut Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729752f-a.text:
Tompkins Ave., at the S.W. corner of Chestnut Ave., showing the Garabaldi Memorial. The house in which Giuseppe Garibaldi lived with his friend Weccai frca 1851 to 1853 stands inside the memorial. A bust of the great Italian patriot is also shown.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) A rear view, at a later date.
January 18, 1931
P.L.Sperr

729753f-c.text:
Tompkins Ave., at the S.W. corner of Chestnut Ave., showing the Garibaldi Memorial. The dwelling in which Giuseppe Garibaldi lived with his friend Meucci from 1851 to 1853 stands inside the meworial. A bust of the great Italian patriot is also shown. This is a set of
three views taken the same day.
Summer 1924.
Views 1,2.o
P. L. Sperr.

729755f-a.text:
Tompkins Avenue, west side, between Chestnut Avenue and Shaughnessy Lane, showing a new city playground under construction o) the W. H. White property. The view is northeastward toward Tompkins Avenue from Shaughnessy Lane and shows the Garibaldi
Memorial on the former.
July 12, 1934
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
July 12, 1934
P. L. Sperr
